records.description: A main conclusion is that although there are large uncertainties (which are not fully reflected in existing estimates of climate change global economic impacts), policy action may be justified in economic terms.
records.title: Assessing the Impacts of Climate Change

records.description: The author emphasizes the importance of taking into consideration historical emissions that builds upon a social, instead of a purely philosophical, lecture of responsibility. International climate change negotiations in the UN framework could lead to the construction of a “climate responsibility.”
records.title: Historical responsibility and equity in international climate change negotiations

records.description: This paper outlines the need for and barriers to private sector investment in International funding for Adaptation. Three ideas to overcome the barriuers are: (1) to put in place a strong enabling environment for private sector, (2) to use public funds to support early entry projects at the country level that will be of sufficient scale to help transform markets and thus pave the way for further private investment, (3) to catalyze private capital with innovative tools that will attract the private sector as an investor at scale.
records.title: The Green Climate Fund : Options for Mobilizing the Private Sector
